(b) Symbol for caution - corrosive, consisting of an Inverted triangle with bones of a hand inside.

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Symbol for caution, consisting of the outline of an inverted triangle.
Symbol for danger, consisting of an outline of an eight-sided shape.
Symbol for warning, consisting of an outline of a diamond shape.
Symbol for corrosive, consisting of an image of the bones of a hand.
Symbol for explosive, consisting of an image of an explosion.
Symbol for flammable, consisting of an image of a flame.
Symbol for poison, consisting of an image of a skull and bones.

table.title: Symbols, Signal Words and Hazard Statements from the Globally Harmonized System of Classification and Labelling of Chemicals (GHS)

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The image of a flame with a thick black edge and the middle of the image, also in the shape of a flame, is white. This image rests above a horizontal black line of the same width as the black contour of the flame. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a flammability hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

The image of a long black gas cylinder with a short neck and that is leaning toward the right, almost horizontally. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a compressed gas hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

row.entry: Contains gas under pressure; may explode if heated
Contains refrigerated gas; may cause cryogenic burns or injury

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Two images side by side. On the right side is a test tube pouring black droplets toward the right onto a hand whose fingers are directed toward the left, with the droplets causing damage at the point of contact. On the left side is another test tube pouring black droplets toward the left onto a black rectangle, with the droplets causing damage at the point of contact. Both images include four vertical wavy lines that radiate from the point of contact to symbolize smoke or fumes. The images of the test tubes have a black outline and white background and include the images of a black liquid near their pour points. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a corrosive hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

row.entry: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The image of a black outline of a skull with a white background and black eyes and nose, over two crossed bones depicted by black outlines on white backgrounds. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of an acute toxicity hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.
The image of a large black exclamation mark. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a health hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

row.entry: May cause an allergic skin reaction

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The image of an upright dead tree to the top left with an upside down dead fish to the bottom right. The fish is pointing head first upwards to the right. The image of the tree is black and the image of the fish is depicted in white with a black outline, both on a white background. Below the fish is a black triangular shape indicating water. The image is set inside a red square set on a point. The image is used to warn about environmental hazards.

Subsection.Text: These Regulations apply to an application to register a pest control product or to amend a registration made on or after August 1, 2007 and before the day on which these Regulations come into force, if the applicant wishes to use or rely on compensable data of a registrant and the Minister has requested in writing that the parties negotiate the amount of compensation payable for that use or reliance.

Despite subsection (1), if the Minister’s request is made more than 60 days before the coming into force of these Regulations and the applicant sends a copy of an agreement to the registrant under subsection 17.8(2) of the Pest Control Products Regulations, as enacted by section 2, the 120-day period specified in subsection 17.9(2) of those Regulations, as enacted by section 2, is reduced to 60 days from the day after the agreement is sent.

Section.Text: Despite paragraph 17.5(3)(b) of the Pest Control Products Regulations, as enacted by section 2, the Minister must extend the exclusive use period established in accordance with section 17.5 of those Regulations, as enacted by section 2, if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there remain at least six months before the exclusive use period expires;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: minor uses are added to the registration on or after August 1, 2007 but before the day on which these Regulations come into force; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the registrant requests an extension of the exclusive use period within 30 days after the day on which these Regulations are published in the Canada Gazette, Part II.

Subsection.Text: In this section, former Regulations means the Pest Control Products Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force.
The validity period of a conditional registration that is in effect before the coming into force of these Regulations continues to be in effect until the end of that period.

The validity period of a conditional registration that continues to be in effect after the coming into force of these Regulations may be extended under subsection 14(6) or (7) of the former Regulations.

Section.Text: The requirements in these Regulations respecting the information that must be shown on the label of a pest control product do not apply until the day on which the first of the following occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration of the pest control product, if it occurs on or after the day on which these Regulations come into force,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the reprinting of the label,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the modification of the information on the label, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacture of the pest control product, if it occurs on or after the tenth anniversary of the day on which these Regulations come into force.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: commencement day means the day on which these Regulations come into force. (date d’entrée en vigueur)
new Regulations means the Pest Control Products Regulations as they read on the commencement day. (nouveau règlement)
secondary display panel has the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Pest Control Products Regulations. (aire d’affichage secondaire)
ultraviolet radiation-emitting device has the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the new Regulations. (dispositif à rayonnement ultraviolet)

Subsection.Text: During the period beginning on commencement day and ending six months after that day, the secondary display panel of an ultraviolet radiation-emitting device referred to in paragraph 4(1)(c) of the new Regulations must contain the statement referred to in paragraph 30.1(3)(b) of the new Regulations or the statement “The use of this device is a supplement to and not a substitute for standard infection control practices; users must continue to follow all current infection control practices, including those related to the cleaning and disinfection of environmental surfaces.”.
The definition device in subsection 1(1) of the Pest Control Products Regulations1 is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: device means an instrument, gadget, apparatus, appliance or other similar object. (dispositif)

Subsection.Text: [In force]
Subsection 1(1) of the Regulations is amended by adding the following in alphabetical order:

Definition.Text: antimicrobial preservative means a chemical substance, or a mixture of chemical substances, that is intentionally incorporated into, or applied to, an article for the purpose of preserving it from deterioration or degradation by preventing the growth of micro-organisms. (agent de conservation antimicrobien)
Stockholm Convention means the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants, signed at Stockholm on May 22, 2001, as amended from time to time. (Convention de Stockholm)
treated article means an inanimate product or substance, but does not include a food as defined in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that, during the manufacturing process, is treated with a pest control product either by intentionally:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: incorporating the product into the article; or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: applying it to the article, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whose primary purpose, prior to that treatment, is not, directly or indirectly, to control, destroy, attract or repel a pest or to mitigate or prevent the injurious, noxious or troublesome effects of a pest. (article traité)

Definition.Text: treated seed means seed into which a pest control product is intentionally incorporated or to which the product is applied. (semence traitée)

Subsection.Text: Section 2 of these Regulations is amended by striking out “and” at the end of paragraph (b) and by adding the following after paragraph (c):

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a treated article; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: treated seed.

Subsection.Text: The portion of paragraph 3(1)(f) of the Regulations before subparagraph (i) is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product — other than an organism, a device of a type described in Schedule 1 or a treated article — that is imported by a user for their personal use, that is in their possession at the time of the importation and that meets the following conditions:

Subsection.Text: Subsection 3(1) of the Regulations is amended by striking out “and” at the end of paragraph (e) and by adding the following after paragraph (f):

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product that is a treated article into which the only pest control product that is incorporated or to which the product is applied is an antimicrobial preservative, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the product is imported by a user for their personal use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the product is in their possession at the time of the importation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the product is in its original package with the original label intact, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the information on the package and label is in English or French and is clear and legible; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an antimicrobial preservative when it is used in the manufacture of a treated article that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a feed that is regulated under the Feeds Act,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a fertilizer or supplement that is regulated under the Fertilizers Act,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a drug or cosmetic that is regulated under the Food and Drugs Act, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: a medical device that is a device as defined in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act and classified as a Class II, III or IV medical device under the Medical Devices Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a treated article that is described in any of clauses (i)(A) to (D) into which the only pest control product that is incorporated or to which the product is applied is an antimicrobial preservative.

Section.Text: Subsection 4(1) of the Regulations is amended by striking out “and” at the end of paragraph (d) and by adding the following after paragraph (e):

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product that is a treated article into which the only pest control product that is incorporated or to which it is applied is an antimicrobial preservative, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the sole purpose of the treatment is to protect or preserve the article,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the active ingredient of the preservative is registered or otherwise authorized under paragraph 21(5)(a) of the Act for incorporation into, or application to the article,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the article is treated in Canada, the preservative is registered or otherwise authorized under paragraph (b) or paragraph 21(5)(a) of the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, the treatment

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: includes the same active ingredient as that contained in a preservative registered in Canada or otherwise authorized under paragraph (b) or paragraph 21(5)(a) of the Act, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: meets any conditions of registration or authorization, as the case may be, that relate to the method of application, the uses for which the preservative may be applied to or incorporated into the article and the range of application rates as specified by the Minister under the Act or as set out in Schedule 2; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product that is a preservative set out in column 1 of Part 2 – Class 2 Preservatives or in column 1 of Part 3 – Class 3 Preservatives of the List of Permitted Preservatives (Lists of Permitted Food Additives), published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the product is used as an antimicrobial preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sole purpose of the treatment is to protect or preserve the article, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of preservative protects or preserves the article, but does not exceed the quantity necessary to do so.

Section.Text: The Regulations are amended by adding the following after section 7:

Subsection.Text: No evaluation under paragraph 7(3)(a) of the Act is necessary when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application is to register or amend the registration of a pest control product that is or contains an active ingredient that is listed as a chemical in Annex A (Elimination) or Annex B (Restriction) of the Stockholm Convention;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the application pertains to a production or use of the active ingredient that is prohibited under the Convention;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amendment to the Convention that resulted in the listing has been ratified by Canada by the deposit of its instrument of ratification with the Secretary-General of the United Nations acting as the Depository of the Convention; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed production or use of the active ingredient in the application:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is not subject to a specific exemption, or acceptable purpose, notified by Canada under the Convention, as set out in the Register of Specific Exemptions, or a Register of Acceptable Purposes, established under that Convention, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is not otherwise permitted under the Convention.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 8(4) of the Act, the health or environmental risks of a pest control product described in subsection (1) are not acceptable.

Section.Text: Paragraph 18(a) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the validity period must not be longer than three years and may not be extended;

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 31(2) of the French version of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:

Les documents visés au paragraphe (1) satisfont aux conditions ci-après si le produit est stocké dans le wagon-citerne ou la remorque-citerne ou est déchargé directement à partir de l’un ou de l’autre :
Paragraph 31(2)(b) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, within reach of and clearly visible to the person operating the control valve that is used for dispensing the product.

Section.Text: Section 36 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the importer of a pest control product — except a pest control product described in paragraph 4(1)(f) or (g) — must provide the Minister with a declaration at the time of the importation, in English or French, signed by the importer, that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the shipper’s name and postal address, along with their email address or telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the importer’s name and address, along with their email address or telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the pest control product, which may include a distinctive brand or trademark;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the number of the pest control product’s licence, certificate, permit, registration, foreign product use certificate, research authorization certificate or research notification certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the pest control product being imported, expressed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by volume, if the product is liquid, gaseous or viscous,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by mass, if the product is a solid or pressure-packed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: by number of units being imported, if the product is a device or a treated article, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in terms specified by the Minister in the conditions of registration under paragraph 8(1)(a) of the Act, in any other case;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the chemical name, common chemical name or other name of each active ingredient of the pest control product, along with its quantity in the pest control product; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose of the importation of the pest control product, expressed as follows:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Distribution, Including Sale”, if the product is being imported for distribution, including sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Manufacturing Purposes”, if the product is being imported for use in the manufacture of a registered pest control product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Research Purposes”, if the product is being imported for research purposes,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Grower Requested Own Use”, if the product is being imported under a foreign product use certificate issued under subsection 41(3), and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: “For (importer to specify the purpose)”, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: The importer of treated seed must provide the Minister with a declaration at the time of the importation, in English or French, signed by the importer, that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the shipper’s name and postal address, along with their email address or telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the importer’s name and address, along with their email address or telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the kind or species of seed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the country where the crop from which the seed is derived was grown;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the number of the treated seed’s licence, certificate, permit, registration, foreign product use certificate, research authorization certificate or research notification certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of treated seed that is being imported, expressed by mass;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the chemical name, common chemical name or other name of each active ingredient of the pest control product that is incorporated into, or applied to, the seed, along with its quantity, expressed by mass or volume, as applicable, per 100 kg of seed;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the treated seed, including any distinctive brand or trademark; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose of the importation of the treated seed, expressed as follows:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Distribution, Including Sale”, if the seed is being imported for distribution, including sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Manufacturing Purposes”, if the seed is being imported for further manufacturing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Research Purposes”, if the seed is being imported for research purposes,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: “For Grower Requested Own Use”, if the seed is being imported under a foreign product use certificate issued under subsection 41(3), and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: “For (importer to specify the purpose)”, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: The importer must keep the information set out in a declaration for two years after the day on which the importation of the pest control product in respect of which the declaration was made.

Section.Text: Section 71 of the Regulations is amended by striking out “and” at the end of paragraph (b) and by replacing paragraph (c) with the following:

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the device, in the case of a device; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the treated article, in the case of a treated article.

Subsection.Text: Subsection 16(2) of the Pest Control Products Regulations1 is amended by striking out “and” at the end of paragraph (c) and by replacing paragraph (d) with the following:

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if sections 17.05 to 17.11 apply, whichever of the following documents is applicable:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that establishes that, as of the date the application is made, a negotiated settlement between the registrant and the data holder has been reached or an arbitral award has been made in respect of the test data and the data holder has not provided a letter of access referred to in section 17.1 to the registrant, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the letter of access referred to in section 17.1; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if sections 17.12 to 17.17 apply, whichever of the following documents is applicable:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that establishes that, as of the date the application is made,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the registrant and data holder are negotiating the compensation payable in respect of the test data,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the determination of the compensation payable in respect of the test data has been submitted to binding arbitration and an arbitral award has not been made, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a negotiated settlement between the registrant and the data holder has been reached or an arbitral award has been made in respect of the test data and the data holder has not provided a letter of access referred to in section 17.17 to the registrant, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the letter of access referred to in section 17.17.

Subsection.Text: Section 16 of the Regulations is amended by adding the following after subsection (2):

Subsection.MarginalNote: Interpretation — data holder and test data
Subsection.Text: In subsection (2), data holder and test data have the same meanings as in section 17.01.

Section.Text: The heading “Interpretation” before section 17.1 of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:
Section 17.1 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:
The following definitions apply in this section and sections 17.02 to 17.17.

Definition.Text: agreement means an agreement referred to in subsection 66(1) of the Act. (entente)
compensable data means test data that the Minister considers for the first time in support of a registration, confirmation of the registration or amendment of the registration, but does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: test data that is referred to in the definition exclusive rights;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: test data that is included in a scientific study that has been published; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: test data that is generated by a scientific study that is fully funded by a government or one of its institutions. (données assujetties à des droits à payer)

Definition.Text: crop group means a group of crops in which the residues at harvest are similar, based on similarities in appearance, harvestable commodity, edible portions and growth habits. (groupe de cultures)
data holder means a registrant to whom compensation may be payable in respect of test data. (détenteur de données)
exclusive rights means the exclusive rights to use or rely on any of the following test data that the Minister considers for the first time in support of a registration:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: test data that the applicant provides in support of an application to register a new active ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: test data that the applicant provides in support of a concurrent application to register a new pest control product that contains the new active ingredient referred to in paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: test data that the applicant provides in support of an application to register a new compound or substance referred to in paragraph 2(b), if the compound or substance has never been an ingredient in a registered pest control product. (droits exclusifs)

Definition.Text: minor use, in respect of a pest control product, means a use the demand for which originates with a grower or a group of growers and which product is intended to be used on a particular pest in connection with a particular host organism, in all of the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use is for an agricultural purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the use is supported by a federal or provincial agricultural authority;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the use is supported by crop residue data or dislodgeable foliar residue data. (usage limité)

Definition.Text: representative crop means a crop in a crop group from which extrapolations of residue levels and maximum residue limits may be made to one or more crops in the group. (culture répresentative)
test data means test data that is provided to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in support of an application to register a pest control product or to amend a registration made under section 7 of the Act, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the context of a re-evaluation or special review, in response to a notice initiating the process under subsection 16(3) or 18(1) of the Act or a notice requiring additional information under paragraph 19(1)(a) of the Act. (données d’essai)

Section.Text: The heading before section 17.2 of the French version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:
Sections 17.2 to 17.94 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

When an applicant wishes to use or rely on the test data of a registrant in order to register a pest control product that is equivalent to the registrant’s product by using an active ingredient provided by the registrant, sections 17.03 to 17.11 do not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registrant provides the Minister with a letter, signed by the registrant, that specifies the active ingredient that they agree to provide to the applicant; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the only active ingredient used in the manufacture of the applicant’s pest control product is the one provided by the registrant.

Subsection.Text: A registrant has exclusive rights for 10 years after the date of registration of the new active ingredient, of the new pest control product that contains the new active ingredient or of the new compound or substance.
The Minister must extend the period of exclusive rights if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registrant meets one of the following requirements:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they proposed a minor use in the concurrent application to register a new pest control product referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition exclusive rights in section 17.01, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they made one of the following applications within seven years after the date of registration of the product referred to in subparagraph (i):

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an application to amend its registration by adding a minor use, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an application to register another new pest control product that contains the same active ingredient as the product and in respect of which a minor use is proposed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registrant requests an extension of the period of exclusive rights, within eight years after the date of registration of the new active ingredient referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition exclusive rights in section 17.01;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister determines that the proposed minor use is a minor use and approves its addition to the registration of the product referred to in subparagraph (a)(i) or the other new pest control product referred to in clause (a)(ii)(B).

Subsection.Text: The Minister must apply the following rules when calculating an extension:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the period of exclusive rights is extended by one year for every three minor uses that are added, whether one or more at a time, to the registration for a total period of exclusive rights of 15 years; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum number of minor uses in respect of a crop group is the number of representative crops in the crop group.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must cancel any extension of one year if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister, on his or her own initiative or in response to a request from the registrant, amends the registration and removes one or more minor uses; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the remaining number of minor uses is insufficient to uphold the extension.

Section.Text: Subject to paragraph 17.05(1)(b), during the period of exclusive rights an applicant may use or rely on a registrant’s test data in an application to register a pest control product or amend a registration if the registrant provides the applicant with written consent to use or rely on the test data.

Section.MarginalNote: Conditions — use of or reliance on test data

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection 17.1(2), an applicant who makes an application to register a pest control product or to amend a registration may, in accordance with the agreement concluded with the data holder under subsection 17.07(2), use or rely on the following test data if they pay compensation to the data holder in accordance with the negotiated settlement or arbitral award for the period provided for in subsection (2) and if the applicant provides the Minister with a copy of a letter of access:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compensable data that the applicant wishes to use or rely on;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: test data for which the data holder has exclusive rights, if the test data is relevant to the pest control product of the data holder and the test data is relevant to an active ingredient that is not equivalent to the active ingredient contained in the applicant’s pest control product; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: test data that was considered during an evaluation or review of a pest control product by a foreign regulatory authority and that the data holder has not previously provided to the Minister, if the following conditions are met:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has considered for the first time the decision that results from the evaluation or review of the pest control product by the foreign regulatory authority in support of the re-evaluation or special review decision of the data holder’s pest control product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister requests that the data holder provide the Minister with the following in the form and manner directed by the Minister:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: documents demonstrating that the test data was provided to the foreign regulatory authority in support of the evaluation or review of the pest control product, or in response to a request from the foreign regulatory authority relating to the evaluation or review,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: documents demonstrating that the foreign regulatory authority considered the test data in support of its decision of the evaluation or review, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the test data, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the data holder complies with the request.

Subsection.Text: The period for which compensation is payable by the applicant to the data holder commences on one of the following days and must not exceed 12 years, except in the case of the test data referred to in paragraph (d) for which the period must not exceed the period set out in section 17.03:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of compensable data in support of an application to register a pest control product of the data holder, the day on which the Minister receives the application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of compensable data in support of an application to amend the registration of a pest control product of the data holder, the day on which the Minister receives the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of compensable data that is considered by the Minister during a re-evaluation or special review of a pest control product of the data holder, if the test data was provided by the data holder in response to a notice initiating the process under subsection 16(3) or 18(1) of the Act or a notice requiring additional information under paragraph 19(1)(a) of the Act, the day on which the Minister receives the data;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of test data referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the day of registration referred to in subsection 17.03(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of test data referred to in paragraph (1)(c), the day on which the Minister initiates the re-evaluation or special review.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 7(2) of the Act, the Minister must provide the applicant with a list of the test data referred to in subsection 17.05(1) for which compensation may be payable by the applicant and in respect of which an agreement is required to be entered into between the applicant and each data holder whose data the applicant wishes to use or rely on.

Subsection.Text: On receipt of the list of test data, an applicant may deliver to each data holder a proposed agreement that specifies the test data that the applicant wishes to use or rely on.
On receipt of the proposed agreement, the data holder must enter into the agreement with the applicant.

Section.MarginalNote: Negotiation of compensation payable and settlement

Subsection.Text: When the agreement is entered into, an applicant and a data holder must, in order to reach a settlement, begin to negotiate the compensation payable in respect of the test data that the applicant wishes to use or rely on.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Period of negotiation and settlement of compensation payable
Subsection.Text: The applicant and the data holder must reach a negotiated settlement in respect of the compensation payable

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within 120 days after the day on which the data holder receives the proposed agreement; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by the end of any additional negotiation period, if the parties agree in writing to continue negotiating.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection 17.08(2), in the absence of a negotiated settlement at the end of the negotiation and in accordance with the agreement entered into by the parties, the applicant may, by delivering to the data holder a written notice, submit the determination of the compensation payable to binding arbitration.
The notice must contain the last offers of the applicant and the data holder, if they were presented in writing at the end of the negotiation.
The arbitrator must make an arbitral award within 120 days after the day on which the notice is delivered, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the parties agree to an extension before the end of that period and provide written notice to the arbitrator; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the arbitrator provides written notice of an extension to the parties before the end of that period.

Subsection.Text: When a negotiated settlement is reached or an arbitral award is made, the data holder must provide the applicant with a letter of access, signed by the data holder, confirming that the applicant may use or rely on their test data.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Failure to provide letter of access
Subsection.Text: If the data holder fails to provide the letter of access within the period specified in the negotiated settlement or arbitral award, the applicant may use or rely on the test data without having to continue to comply with the settlement or award.

The applicant may, as soon as a notice referred to in subsection 17.09(1) has been delivered to the data holder, request that the Minister register their pest control product before obtaining a letter of access and may use or rely on the test data of the data holder if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant enters into an escrow agreement with a third party;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the third party is entitled under the laws of a province to receive and hold an amount of money on behalf of another person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: under the escrow agreement, the applicant deposits with the third party an amount of money equal to the data holder’s last offer referred to in subsection 17.09(2);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the escrow agreement contains all of the following terms:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the third party holds the money until it becomes payable in accordance with the escrow agreement,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on receipt of a copy of the registration certificate, the third party pays the data holder an amount of money equal to the applicant’s last offer referred to in subsection 17.09(2),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: on receipt of a copy of the negotiated settlement or arbitral award, the third party pays the data holder the compensation payable as determined in the settlement or award, less the amount paid under subparagraph (ii),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the third party pays any remaining balance to the applicant.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must send the Minister both a copy of the escrow agreement and proof that the applicant has deposited the money in accordance with paragraph (1)(c).

Subsection.MarginalNote: When no last offer in writing
Subsection.Text: If the data holder’s last offer was not made in writing at the end of the negotiation, the conditions set out in subsection (1) and subsection (2) do not apply.

Section.MarginalNote: Conditions — use of or reliance on test data

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection 17.17(2), in the context of a re-evaluation or special review and on receipt of a notice initiating the process under subsection 16(3) or 18(1) of the Act or a notice requiring additional information under paragraph 19(1)(a) of the Act, a registrant may, in accordance with the agreement concluded with the data holder under subsection 17.14(2), use or rely on the following test data if they pay compensation to the data holder in accordance with the negotiated settlement or arbitral award for the period set out in subsection (2):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compensable data that the registrant wishes to use or rely on that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: provided to the Minister, in the context of the re-evaluation or special review, by the data holder in response to a notice initiating the process under subsection 16(3) or 18(1) of the Act or to a notice requiring additional information under paragraph 19(1)(a) of the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: relevant to the pest control product that is the subject of the re-evaluation or special review; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: test data that the Minister considers in support of the re-evaluation or special review decision in respect of the pest control product but that was not provided in response to one of the notices referred to in paragraph (a) and that is relevant to an active ingredient that is not equivalent to the active ingredient contained in the pest control product that is the subject of the re-evaluation or special review if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the test data is already compensable data, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the data holder already has exclusive rights in respect of the test data.

Subsection.Text: The period for which compensation is payable for the following test data by the registrant to the data holder commences on one of the following days and must not exceed 12 years, except in the case of the test data referred to in subparagraph (b)(ii) for which the period must not exceed the period provided for in section 17.03:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of compensable data provided by the data holder under paragraph (1)(a), the day on which the Minister receives the data; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of test data referred to in paragraph (1)(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the data is already compensable data, one of the days referred to in paragraph 17.05(2)(a), (b), (c) or (e), as the case may be, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the data holder already has exclusive rights in respect of the data, the day of registration referred to in subsection 17.03(1).

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsections 16(5) and (5.1) and 18(3) and (3.1) of the Act, the Minister must make available to data holders and other registrants, on the day on which the Minister makes public the decision statement referred to in subsection 28(5) of the Act, a list of the test data referred to in subsection 17.12(1) in respect of which compensation may be payable by any of those registrants and in respect of which an agreement is required to be entered into between the registrant and each data holder whose data the registrant wishes to use or rely on.

Subsection.Text: Either the registrant or the data holder may deliver to the other party a proposed agreement that specifies the test data that the registrant wishes to use or rely on no later than 60 days after the day on which the decision statement referred to in subsection 28(5) of the Act is made public.
The registrant or the data holder must, on receipt of the proposed agreement from the other party, enter into the agreement with the other party.

Section.MarginalNote: Negotiation of compensation payable and settlement

Subsection.Text: When the agreement is entered into, a registrant and a data holder must, in order to reach a settlement, begin to negotiate the compensation payable in respect of the test data that the registrant wishes to use or rely on.
The registrant and the data holder must reach a negotiated settlement in respect of the compensation payable

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within 120 days after the day on which the decision statement referred to in subsection 28(5) of the Act is made public; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by the end of any additional negotiation period, if the parties agree in writing to continue negotiating.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection 17.15(2), in the absence of a negotiated settlement at the end of the negotiation and in accordance with the agreement entered into by the parties, the registrant or the data holder may, by delivering to the other party a written notice, submit the determination of the compensation payable to binding arbitration.
The notice must contain the last offers of the registrant and the data holder, if they were presented in writing at the end of the negotiation.
The arbitrator must make an arbitral award within 120 days after the day on which the notice is delivered, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the parties agree to an extension before the end of that period and provide written notice to the arbitrator; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the arbitrator provides written notice of an extension to the parties before the end of that period.

Subsection.Text: When a negotiated settlement is reached or an arbitral award is made, the data holder must provide the registrant with a letter of access, signed by the data holder, confirming that the registrant may use or rely on their test data.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Failure to provide letter of access
Subsection.Text: If the data holder fails to provide the letter of access within the period specified in the negotiated settlement or arbitral award, the registrant may use or rely on the test data without having to continue to comply with the settlement or award.
Paragraph 38(3)(b) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test data referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) of the definition exclusive rights in section 17.01 that were provided in support of its registration are no longer subject to exclusive rights within the meaning of that definition.

Subsection.Text: Section 38 of the Regulations is amended by adding the following after subsection (3):
In subsection (3), test data has the same meaning as in section 17.01.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections 8 to 12:

Definition.Text: Act means the Pest Control Products Act. (Loi)
commencement day means the day on which these Regulations come into force. (date d’entrée en vigueur)
former Regulations means the Pest Control Products Regulations as they read immediately before the commencement day. (règlement antérieur)
new Regulations means the Pest Control Products Regulations as they read on the commencement day. (nouveau règlement)

Subsection.Text: The new Regulations apply in respect of an application to register a pest control product or to amend a registration if a decision under subsection 8(1) of the Act in respect of the application is pending on the commencement day.

Despite section 17.06 of the new Regulations, the Minister is not required to provide a new list in respect of an application referred to in subsection (1) if the Minister provided a list in respect of the application under subsection 17.8(1) of the former Regulations.

Section.Text: If a portion of a period of exclusive use referred to in section 17.5 of the former Regulations remains on the commencement day, the portion is deemed to be the remaining portion of a period of exclusive rights as defined in section 17.01 of the new Regulations.

In the context of a re-evaluation or special review of a pest control product, the new Regulations apply in respect of test data received by the Minister in response to one of the following notices that was delivered on or after June 3, 2010 and before the commencement day, if the Minister has not made public a decision statement in respect of the re-evaluation or special review under subsection 28(5) of the Act before the commencement day:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice initiating the re-evaluation or special review under subsection 16(3) or 18(1) of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the re-evaluation or special review commenced on or after June 28, 2006, a notice requiring additional information under paragraph 19(1)(a) of the Act.

Section.Text: In the context of a re-evaluation or special review of a pest control product, the former Regulations apply in respect of test data received by the Minister in response to one of the following notices that was delivered on or after June 3, 2010 and before the commencement day, if the Minister has made public a decision statement in respect of the re-evaluation or special review under subsection 28(5) of the Act before the commencement day:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice initiating the re-evaluation or special review under subsection 16(3) or 18(1) of the Act or a notice initiating any previous re-evaluation or special review under those provisions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the re-evaluation or special review or any previous re-evaluation or special review commenced on or after June 28, 2006, a notice requiring additional information under paragraph 19(1)(a) of the Act.

Section.Text: In the context of a re-evaluation or special review of a pest control product, the former Regulations apply in respect of test data provided in support of an application by another registrant under subsection 7(1) of the Act to register another pest control product or to amend its registration if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the active ingredient contained in the pest control product that is the subject of the re-evaluation or special review is not equivalent to the active ingredient contained in the other pest control product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the re-evaluation or special review commenced on or after June 28, 2006;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the application was made on or after June 3, 2010; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has made public a decision statement in respect of the re-evaluation or special review under subsection 28(5) of the Act on or after September 21, 2017 but before the commencement date.
